file_content.text: I sensed Nomen Karr's death from across the galaxy.
I must admit, after all these years, to be rid of him... it has unsettled me a bit.
I did what I thought you would want. Was I in error?
Did I displease you?
Not in the least, my apprentice.
A worthy adversary is hard to come by.
I understand, master.
Don't worry, a good Sith is always cultivating new enemies.
Gather your wits, Baras.
Get over it.
Don't mistake me, apprentice.
I am not wounded by this development. Merely bathing in the full breadth of its implications.
I've been informed that my soldiers are bringing Nomen Karr to me. A pleasant surprise.
I'll have the final word in my war with that Jedi. He will die a thousand deaths.
His body and spirit are already ravaged.
Facing me took a toll on him.
Don't you worry, I'll fatten him up before I bleed him dry.
If you enjoy swatting at caged fleas, knock yourself out.
Where's the challenge in that?
Someday, you may have a nemesis, and then you'll understand.
Some people are easy to get gifts for.
I knew you'd be pleased.
Somehow I doubt defeating Nomen Karr was easy.
Apprentice, my soldiers informed me that you subdued Master Karr, but I've heard no further update.
What has transpired? Where is Nomen Karr?
I left him there, a beaten and empty shell.
In despair.
I see. I had hoped to get my hands on him, but I suppose my imagination will have to suffice.
Through the Force, I did feel some of his pain. It was a spectacular sensation.
Once the directive was achieved, I saw no reason to keep him alive.
[Lie] He's dead.
Interesting. I would have thought I'd sense his death.
No matter, I suppose. The demise of Nomen Karr is... a long time in the making. And will be long remembered.
What became of him is inconsequential.
This was never about Karr.
I suppose that's true. It was the girl who posed the threat.
I see you have a new passenger. Jaesa Willsaam, I presume.
This is my master, Darth Baras.
Say hello, Jaesa.
Greetings, my lord.
Your parents are alive and thriving here on Dromund Kaas. They'll be so pleased to know you are safe.
Please tell them I have never been happier.
You've endured quite a lot, young one. But you seem to have come through it rather well. Would you agree?
I am very pleased with the outcome.
That's right.
What was your first clue?
Good guess.
I sense her devotion to you, apprentice. How ever did you manage that?
I learned from the best, master.
By following your example.
Haha! Excellent. The perfect disciple.
I have a way with people.
Marvelous, apprentice, simply marvelous.
When will you realize there is nothing I cannot accomplish?
I can do anything.
I'll admit, this is more than I was expecting.
There's no denying you are a master of the dark arts now.
Only the most accomplished among us are named as lords among Sith. You have more than earned the distinction. I hereby confer the title of Sith Lord upon you.
I'm humbled, master.
Through your exemplary service, you honor yourself.
I award a considerable stipend to those who attain such rank in my service. Enjoy it.
Such a distinction means nothing to me.
Titles are for the vain.
I see. There is a considerable stipend I bequeath to those who attain the rank in my service.
Should I forego your reward then? My lord?
Lord, huh? I'm beginning to like the sound of that.
Point taken.
I thought so. Nice to see your stubborn streak isn't immune to good sense.
Do whatever you like, it's no skin off my back.
I don't care.
Such stubbornness. I do not feel the need to compete with it. Enjoy your reward.
You'd better pay what I've earned.
Don't you dare.
You seem determined to spoil this wonderful moment and ruin my good mood.
Despite your idiotic behavior, it would dishonor me not to reward you for such great accomplishments. Consider yourself very fortunate.
About time.
Mind who you're dealing with.
As lethal as you must be to become a lord, a Darth is the embodiment of death. Don't forget that.
Now, celebrate as you see fit, then return to me here on Dromund Kaas. I have great plans for us.
Wow, a lord. I'm impressed.
Congratulations, my lord.
I have much higher aspirations.
This is nothing.
I will do my best to see you achieve them.
You've both been a great help.
Thank you.
Service is its own reward.
Yeah, what he said.
Get back to your posts.
Save it.
Of course.
I already prepared Jaesa's quarters. I'll go ahead and show her to them.
Nice of you to assume some initiative.
Good thinking, Vette.
I'm here to help. Come on, Jaesa, let's get you set up.
Make it quick then resume your duties.
Fine, but no fraternizing.
Aw, but we were going to stay up gossiping. Come on, Jaesa, follow me.
Perhaps you would be more comfortable in my room, Jaesa.
[Flirt] How about my quarters?
This is not a luxury vessel. We do not coddle here. Let Jaesa discover things on her own.
Leave her.
Fine. Just trying to be sociable.
I'm sure I can find my own way.
I didn't tell you to show her to her quarters, Twi'lek.
You will not. [Shock Vette]
Yow! Fine, fine, excuse me for volunteering!
My lord, did she really deserve that?
It's an old habit from my less enlightened days.
You're right.
You... you're kidding! I don't have to wear the shock collar any more?
You've endured it long enough.
That's right.
Just do as you are told and remain moderately quiet.
As long as you behave.
You bet. No problem.
I'm sure the power cell is almost dead.
I've worn it out anyway.
Better it than me.
Jaesa, I for one am very happy you've joined our party.
As am I.
There are things you don't understand, Jaesa.
I have my reasons.
I beg your pardon. I hope in time to comprehend everything.
Hardship and discomfort make her kind happy.
[Lie] Twi'leks like pain.
Oh. Is that true, Twi'lek?
Sorry, can't hear ya. The pain makes my ears ring--it's nice, though--up tempo. I'm starting to like it.
I see I have a lot to learn about the galaxy and its many creatures.
That's a handy toy. Might I... might I try it?
When you've earned it, it will be a special reward.
Some day, perhaps.
As you decree, my lord.
Great. Sure hope you're a screwup.
Don't count on it.
Here, enjoy yourself.
Be my guest.
Lovely. I just press this, ri--
Yeeaaarrrrr! Hold it down a little longer, why don't you!
All right. Thank you for the tip.
Ow ow ow! Bantha poo! Give that thing back to the master!
Use it sparingly. We don't want to completely fry her brain.
Easy, Jaesa.
I understand, my lord.
Yeah... right... lesson learned, I guess. Sheesh.
Take it off the bridge. Be sure you're ready when I call for you.
Both of you leave now.
Do as you will. Just stop shy of permanent damage.
Have fun, Jaesa.
Yes, my lord.
Ouch! Quit it. Yow! You're a pain. Drat! I hate you.
It's not a toy--it is a master's tool. I'm the only one who disciplines Vette.
For my use only.
Too bad. Looks like fun, but I understand.
Maybe the master will let you borrow it for your birthday.
I think you must secretly like it.
You never learn. [Shock Vette]
Aggghhh! Yeah right, what's not to like?
I've always thought Twi'leks made good slaves.
Now, I will find my room, settle in and prepare myself.
We have no time for this. There's a galaxy to conquer.
Enough banter.
Of course. I'll just go find my room and prepare myself.
Be assured, my lord, I'll be ready for your next order, whatever it may be.
I like that idea. Quinn will have the controller on his birthday as well.
An excellent suggestion.
I'll be living for it, my lord.
Tell me when your birthday is, Quinn, so I can schedule my suicide.
Yes, I definitely think I'm going to like it here. Now, off to find my room.
Whenever you need me, my lord, whatever your order, I'll be ready.
Excellent.
Perhaps I'll come and check on you in your quarters later.
[Flirt] I'll pay you a visit.
Please, my lord, I don't want the crew to get the wrong idea.
We wouldn't want that.
Of course.
Yeah, you wouldn't want me to get the wrong idea. Right?
Yeah, it'd be pretty shocking if anything inappropriate happened around here.
You're right. Better to reserve it for moments when we're alone.
I'll flirt in private, then.
Uh, all right, I appreciate it. I think.
No, please, if you're going to flirt with her, I'd rather you did it in front of my face.
Well, I sure appreciate it. Makes me nauseous.
Caring what others think is the mark of vanity.
Don't be so self-conscious.
I... I think I understand. You're testing me, right?
No, Jaesa, actually he's testing me.
Try to have a sense of humor.
Deal with it, Vette.
I'll borrow Quinn's, he never uses his.
Go ahead and visit Jaesa's room. You'll find mine locked.
I think you're even more beautiful when you're green.
[Flirt] Jealousy suits you.
Hmm. Well, then by all means, flirt away.
Don't worry, I save my serious flirts for you.
It meant nothing, Vette.
You'd better.
Check to make sure our new guest is settled in to her room. Then meet me in mine.
I don't know about you, Quinn, but this is gonna be fun to watch.
Don't save me a seat, Vette, I've got work to do.
Oh. Right. I forgot. You're a stick in the mud.
Don't think it's going to be that easy, my lord.
Oh, I really like her.
Make this ship your home.
Get comfortable.
You are so very gracious.
There is a difference between obedience and brown-nosing. Learn it.
Don't overdue it, supplicant.
Yes , my lord. I'll get right on it.
So, my lord, now you have the girl. A victory, I dare say, even Baras failed to anticipate.
I'm a bit perplexed. Your methods have been rather... unorthodox to this point.
I know what I'm doing, Captain.
Trust me.
There are many ways to win a war, Quinn.
The goal is still the same.
We will be the catalyst that ushers in a new paradigm for the galaxy.
The Empire must change.
I am open-minded and ready for the evolution, my lord.
You've become a Sith Lord, and your power base is growing. Where are your sights set now?
Now we crush all the Empire's enemies and bring the Republic to its knees.
On mayhem and destruction.
I hope to be there when you deal the final blow.
My plans are my own, Captain. I will share them with you when the time is right.
Mind your station, Quinn.
Of course, my lord. Apologies.
For the time being, we follow orders. But soon, we set our sights on the master.
On Baras, eventually.
If my talents can be of help, I hope you will utilize them.
I leave you to enjoy this achievement.
I have received a transmission from Nomen Karr--calling me out, if you will. Challenging me to face him to the death. Our enemy has become desperate.
Allow me the privilege of destroying him.
I volunteer, master.
You have read my mind, apprentice.
He must have lost his mind.
He's unhinged.
Your efforts to disrupt his precious Padawan have unnerved him. He seeks to turn the tides.
I'm sure you'll defeat him, master.
Good luck with that.
Oh, I have no intention of making the meeting.
Karr fails to understand--I have outgrown our personal dispute.
He expects me to jump at the chance of strangling him. He will be unprepared for you.
I am ready.
Don't you want to vanquish your nemesis yourself?
It should be your kill.
Nomen Karr is just a vehicle to my greater goal.
Sounds like you're trying to avoid confronting him.
Are you unwilling?
Jaesa Willsaam has felt your disruptions, not mine. You are what will draw her out.
The duel is to happen on Hutta, at the site of Nomen Karr's betrayal so long ago. A fitting place for this to end.
Defeat him, but do not kill him. His torment will reach out to his Padawan. He will be the bait that brings her to you.
I consider it a privilege.
Good thinking.
If you say so.
I can feel Jaesa Willsaam on the verge of breaking. And Karr's desperate actions confirm it.
Subdue the Master, and the pupil will come to save him. I have foreseen it.
Apprentice, the timing of this call is fortuitous. I was just about to contact you with news.
The Padawan bade me meet with her, so I went to end this. But two of Karr's Jedi friends were waiting instead.
I have news too--Jaesa called.
Fascinating. It seems both Master and Padawan have been disturbed by your exploits.
I'm eager to hear it.
I'm ready, master.
I'm pleased to report that your exploits have been successful.
It's about time--I was growing impatient. Tell me what's developed.
You kept me waiting too long.
It's gratifying to see that you are as obsessed with this as I.
Every lead followed perfectly. Every planet ravaged. Our adversary is growing antsy, I can feel it. Expect news soon. Baras out.
My lord, I thought it prudent not to interrupt Darth Baras. We received a recorded transmission. It is queued when you are ready.
Sith, I'm Jaesa Willsaam. My Master, Nomen Karr, has no idea I'm sending this message. Let's be real--we both know this isn't about us.
Ah, the hunted seeks the hunter.
Our masters pretend otherwise, but this is personal.
You and I are only pawns in their private war. And those I care about are caught in the middle. It has to stop.
Wow, gotta give it to her--she sure got guts.
She certainly does.
You're right.
Her guts will be pouring out when I catch up to her.
Not for long.
Okay, gross.
I'm trying to listen.
Quiet, Vette.
Sorry.
I'm concentrating, slave.
Shut up. [Shock Vette]
Yaaahhh! Don't let my screaming get in the way!
I appreciate directness. Your brutal actions have my attention, but this passive-aggressive foolishness is intolerable.
I sense inconsistency in your actions. Maybe you're as tired of all this passive-aggressive foolishness as I am.
I appreciate directness. And as merciful as your actions have been, it's time you stopped this passive-aggressive campaign.
This message includes coordinates where I'll be waiting in my ship. Let's discuss this face-to-face. No more nonsense.
What do you think of that, Captain?
Quinn, your impression.
It could be a trap, my lord. Nomen Karr may have put her up to it.
Hey, don't listen to Captain Paranoid here. I don't think it's a trap. I trust her.
I'll take that under advisement.
Noted.
Thanks for the input, Vette.
Appreciate it.
How can that naive thing be a threat to Darth Baras?
She doesn't seem like much.
No more nonsense is right. That girl just signed her death certificate.
She's dead.
My lord, there may be more to this. I wouldn't necessarily trust her.
So paranoid. Don't listen to Captain Stuffy; he's going to die alone and friendless.
I'm not looking to make friends.
Unlikely.
You might be right, Vette.
Good advice.
When I want your opinion, I'll slap myself for being stupid.
Who asked you?
Your opinion doesn't count, slave. Especially when it isn't asked for.
Time for pain. [Shock Vette]
Yow! Garbage, Wookiee poo, that hurts!
The coordinates are set, my lord. We can rendezvous with her ship whenever you give the word.
You crushed Alderaan under your boot, apprentice. I am incredibly impressed; the planet will feel the sting for years to come.
I am your humble servant, master.
Just doing my duty
I savored the destruction.
It felt good.
Yet, all this is merely prelude.
I better be earning much more than your accolades.
You should be impressed.
When all is accomplished, the benefits will be considerable.
Nomen Karr's Padawan can no longer hide in anonymity. I am pleased.
By rooting out this Jaesa Willsaam's parents, you have reached across the galaxy to strike a sharp blow at our enemies.
Only Tatooine remains. Jaesa Willsaam's powers were brought to the surface there. Contact me when you arrive.
You have done admirably, apprentice. Your time on Tatooine was well-spent.
Nomen Karr's Padawan, Jaesa Willsaam, no longer enjoys anonymity. I am very pleased.
That makes me happy.
Make sure the engraver for her tombstone has the name spelled right.
Now I know who to kill.
No, no. There will be no evidence of her existence. She will be buried in an unmarked grave.
We haven't found her yet.
Don't celebrate too loudly.
This is a lesson I do not need to be taught, youngster.
Your handling of Master Yonlach has sent our enemies a clear message.
Nomen Karr and Jaesa Willsaam now know they cannot hide. It gnaws at the Master and will bring his prized Padawan to her knees.
You are a master strategist, my lord.
Your plan is well-conceived.
It is deeply satisfying to see a plan take shape.
I cannot wait to get my hands on them.
The anticipation is palpable.
I believe that moment is rushing toward us.
You certainly have a lot riding on that theory, Baras.
Better hope you're right.
Oh, don't doubt me. It's not a theory, apprentice.
Only Alderaan remains. Jaesa Willsaam's homeworld. Go there immediately. I will contact you when you arrive.
Apprentice, now that Nomen Karr realizes that we seek his Padawan, there's no time to waste.
He claimed the girl on her home planet of Alderaan, and she trained on Tatooine. I have agents on both planets digging up leads.
Find the people who know this girl. Someone means enough to her to make her come out of hiding.
I will obliterate everything she knows.
Leave that to me.
I doubt that Jedi will let her out of his sight.
Karr has her locked away.
You may be right. But as you close in on his prized pupil, he will be forced to deal with us.
Sounds like a lot of guess work to me.
Not much of a plan.
Do not doubt me, apprentice. The girl must have family on Alderaan, and I have theories about what lies on Tatooine.
I am confident this is how we will prevail.
The Padawan's training is incomplete. She is susceptible. The anguish you cause will flush her out, and you will kill her and her Master.
The order is given.
This will be a great test for you, apprentice.
Perhaps the Padawan can be turned.
Or show her the dark side.
Her power would be a great asset, yes. Put through enough torment, she may reveal her base nature.
But we must be cautious. The danger she represents is extreme. As long as she lives, she is a threat.
Seduction to the dark side should be left to masters. If there is even a sliver of doubt in your heart, it can backfire.
I will be mindful, master.
Understood.
My heart is immune to doubt.
I am pure.
Don't deny doubt. It can feed as well as any other emotion.
I don't appreciate your condescension.
Do you belittle me?
Don't be so bruisable, apprentice. It's the mark of insecurity.
At last, a challenge worthy of me.
I'm ready to be tested.
I only hope you are up to that challenge.
You have yet to face a Jedi Master. Their righteousness and passionless demeanor is nauseating.
And Nomen Karr is no ordinary Master. Confronting him, you will find profound fortitude and hate, or you will falter.
I will not falter. My hate knows no bounds.
Success will be mine.
Just be sure it serves you.
It will be an interesting experience.
My curiosity is piqued.
Be sure your results are of interest to me.
Save the rhetoric. Let me get to work.
I'm not worried.
Learn to heed my wisdom, or you will die.
Be off, then. Tatooine and Alderaan await. Discover this Padawan's identity and destroy her.
It seems our adversary is of like-mind. Your efforts have not gone unnoticed. Nomen Karr has been busy.
Enlighten me, master.
I'm all ears.
I wouldn't expect him to be complacent.
Of course he has.
Good. Then you're less likely to be caught unaware.
Stop being so cryptic and tell me what's happened.
Get to the point.
Use that tone sparingly with me, apprentice. Consider this a warning.
It appears your ship is being tracked. A very sophisticated sensor is reporting your every movement.
I've traced the signal to a spaceport in a sector not far from you. I'm sure Nomen Karr is involved.
Send me to this spaceport. Perhaps Karr is there, and I can end this.
I hope it is him.
Nomen Karr is a Master of the Jedi arts--do not take him lightly.
It seems likely.
No doubt.
Sounds to me like you're being paranoid.
You're losing it, Baras.
I just warned you about your attitude. Do you think that because you are not within sight, I cannot... reach you?
This... is not... the way to... inspire... my... respect... Baras....
Choking me won't work.
I am your master. There is no burden on me to inspire your respect. It is mine already. Do you understand?
Master... you... appear to be... choking me. Have I... upset you...? It... was not... intentional....
My mistake.
Then be more mindful. Even accidental disrespect is a punishable offense.
Why don't... you... try... choking me... when I'm... in... your presence....
Coward.
Do you believe yourself to be indispensable? Who are you that I should accept such insolence?
I... thought you... could... take a... joke. If I... was... mistaken I... apologize....
I was just kidding.
We don't have the luxury for jokes, apprentice. I release you, but do not forget this lesson.
I... understand... my... master. Please... release me....
You're right, I'm wrong.
You're... so... sensitive. Maybe you... should... grow a little... thicker... skin....
Grow up.
My blood is boiling, apprentice. Persist in this manner, and yours will grow still.
Y--you... have proven... your... p--point... Baras....
Fine. You win.
I expect I will not have to remind you again.
L--lesson... learned... master. I... am... your... humble... servant....
I apologize.
Much better. Breathe, apprentice.
G--go... ahead... and... k--kill... me....
Strike me down, then.
I think not. Breathe again, fool.
If wielded against me too often, your stubbornness will be the end of you, apprentice. But it will serve me in other endeavors.
I'll... be more selective with it in the... future, master.
Point taken.
Be sure that you are.
I'm... glad you see it that way, Baras.
Remember my value.
If it... serves you, you should learn to... tolerate it better.
Then indulge me more.
You are the one with much to learn.
We've wasted enough time with your foolishness.
I've transmitted the coordinates of the spaceport to you. Investigate and punish whoever is tracking you. That is all.
I do not appreciate your doubt. I expect unwavering respect at all times. Consider yourself warned.
I've sent the coordinates to your mainframe. Head there immediately, dock with the station and make a lasting impression.
You have done well, my apprentice. Dellocon eliminated and Lord Rathari dispelled. This will be a day long remembered.
Killed is more accurate.
The loss of Halidrell Setsyn is unfortunate, but the ends far justify the means.
She served you honorably, master.
She died well.
I had a soft spot for her as well.
She will be easily replaced.
No big loss.
Yes, I will place my slave operations in good hands, rest assured.
As long as you get what you want, the ends always justify the means, don't they?
That your entire philosophy?
Power depends on seeing the big picture.
Now, before I unleash you on Nomen Karr and his Padawan, my spy on Balmorra must be eliminated. Go now and be swift.
Apprentice, I see you are ready to put Balmorra behind you. Good.
The elimination of Commander Rylon grants security to my spy network, but there is still more to be done.
I'll take care of everything.
You haven't yet. But every new challenge offers the chance of failure.
I'm primed for the next bloodbath.
Time to kill, then.
I weep for anyone who gets in your way.
It's always work, work, work with you.
Ease up, Baras.
When all this is over, there will be time to relax.
You have successfully eliminated both of my compromised agents. The time has come to set our sights on Nomen Karr and his gifted Padawan.
Now, before I unleash you on Nomen Karr and his Padawan, you must eliminate my spy on Nar Shaddaa. Head there immediately.
There is no time to waste. Speed to your next directive. I'll speak with you further once you've arrived.
